text: Which of the following physical quantities is correctly paired with it's corresponding S.I unit?
A liquid of volume 2.00 m3 and density 1.00 x 103 is mixed with 3.00 m3 of another liquid of density 8.00 x 103kg m-3. Calculate the density of the mixture [Assuming there is no chemical reaction]
Which of the following statements about solid friction are correct? It  i. is a force  ii. occurs between the surfaces of two bodies in contact  iii. depends on the area in contact

A mass of mass m, experiences a viscous drag, F and an upthrust, U as he descends towards the ground at a steady velocity, Using a parachute. If the acceleration of free fall is g, which of the following expressions is correct?
explanation:
The forces acting on the mass include:
Weight: W = mg (downward)Upthrust: U (upward)Viscous Drag: F (upward)
Since the mass is descending at a steady velocity, the net force acting on it is zero. This means that the upward forces (upthrust and viscous drag) balance the downward force (weight): mg = U + F = U + F - mg = 0

text: a body moving at a constant speed accelerates when it is in
explanation: A body moving at a constant speed can accelerate if it is in circular motion. This is because acceleration is a change in velocity, and velocity is a vector quantity, meaning it has both magnitude (speed) and direction. In circular motion, the direction of the velocity is constantly changing, even if the speed is constant, so there is acceleration.

text: An object of mass 2 kg moves with a uniform speed of 10ms-1 for 5s along a straight path. Determine the magnitude of its acceleration
The term rectilinear acceleration means the rate of increase of

options.A: velocity along a circular path in a unit time
options.B: distance along a rectangular path in a unit time
options.C: displacement along a straight-line path in a unit time
options.D: velocity along a straight-line path in a unit time

explanation: Rectilinear acceleration refers to the acceleration experienced by an object moving in a straight line (rectilinear motion). Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which aligns with the rate of increase of velocity along a straight-line path.

text: A rectangular glass prism of thickness d and absolute refractive index n is placed on a point object which is viewed vertically downward from above the prism. Which of the following expressions correctly defines the apparent upward displacement of the object?
Which of the following factors can affect the speed of sound in air?  i. The temperature of the surrounding  ii. The direction of the wind  iii. The pitch of the sound.
A sounding tuning fork is brought near the open end of a pipe containing air and the loudness of the sound is observed to increase. This observation is due to
explanation: When the frequency of the tuning fork matches the natural frequency of the air column in the pipe, resonance occurs. This causes the air in the pipe to vibrate more vigorously, amplifying the sound and increasing its loudness.

Which of the following statements is correct about resonance? Resonance occurs when a body

options.B: is forced to vibrate on its own natural frequency by another body at the same vibration
options.C: vibrates at the frquency of the body causing the vibration

explanation: Resonance occurs when a body is forced to vibrate at its own natural frequency by another body vibrating at the same frequency.

In a nuclear reactor, chain reactions result from the release of

The correct sequence of energy transformation in the operation of an x-ray tube is i. X-rays ii. Kinetic energy of thermo electrons iii. Potential energy of the target atoms iv. Heat energy of the emitted electrons
explanation: X–rays are a stream of particles that are emitted when fast accelerating or moving electrons collide with a tungsten target.  X-rays are produced when electrons produced by thermionic emission are accelerated through high voltage and are focused onto a tungsten target. The accelerated electrons strike the tungsten target, transform into heat, and emit radiation called x-rays.  So the correct sequence of energy transformation in the operation of an X-ray tube is  Option C.
